newsitem.title: USA: John H. Harland to review dividends in 1997.
newsitem.headline: John H. Harland to review dividends in 1997.

text.p: John H. Harland Co said Monday that its board plans to review the company's dividend strategy in early 1997 as part of the company's growth initiatives.
The company said however that no change will be made it its quarterly dividend of $0.255 per share, payable December 5 to shareholders of record November 21.
The company previously announced that it would consolidate its 40 imprint plants into seven regional printing plants.
The company said Monday that facilities for the plants should be available six months earlier than planned, eliminating the need for transitional plants.
The company said moving directly into the regional plants "will delay certain plant closings for the balance of 1996 and the first quarter of 1997," but accelerate consolidation.
